newsitem.title: CROATIA: BNP buys stake in Croatian hotelier Laguna.
newsitem.headline: BNP buys stake in Croatian hotelier Laguna.

text.p: Croatian hotelier Plava Laguna said on Tuesday that Banque Nationale de Paris (BNP) bought an 11.03-percent stake in the company from Banque Indosuez.
Geneva-based Indosuez International Finance B.V. transferred its 60,236 ordinary shares to BNP on March 21, the company advised its shareholders in an advertisement in the daily Vecernji List.
The price of the transaction was not disclosed.
Plava Laguna has an equity of 970 million kuna, of which small shareholders control around 39 percent and troubled Croatian bank Privredna Banka 32.67 percent.
Banque Indosuez was earlier estimated to have 12.5 percent in the company, hoping for a modest four to five million kuna net for 1996 on 190 million kuna income.
Its stock closed last week at 1,443 kuna on the Zagreb bourse.
